content: vintage doily found at an antique store re­drafted by me for your enjoyment; have fun crocheting supplies size 30 thread size 11 hook scissors key to stitches r = ring chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch double_crochet = double_crochet tb = treble_crochet nxt = next space = space skip = skip x = repeat the number of times the number that follows * and ** = start and stop of repeats directions for motif chain 10 form ring round 1 chain 3 counts as double_crochet 23 double_crochet in r slip_stitch to top of chain 3 total stitches for round 24 double_crochet round 2 chain 4 counts as double_crochet and ch1 double_crochet ch1 in nxt double_crochet* repeat in each double_crochet around slip_stitch in top of ch3 24 double_crochet 24 chain space round 3 slip_stitch into nxt chain space chain 10 counts as 1 treble_crochet and 6 chain * skip nxt chain space treble_crochet in nxt space chain 6* around slip_stitch in 4th chain of starting chain 12 treble_crochet and 12 chain sps round 4 chain 1 single_crochet in same st * chain 2 double_crochet ch2 double_crochet ch2 **in nxt space single_crochet in nxt treble_crochet* repeat from * to * 10 more times repeat from * to ** once more slip_stitch in top of single_crochet 12 v_stitch round 5 chain 1 single_crochet in same stitch * ch2 double_crochet in nxt space x3 ch2 single_crochet in nxt single_crochet* repeat from * to * around join with slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet finish off thread joining round round 5 chain 1 single_crochet in same stitch * ch2 double_crochet in nxt space chain 1 single_crochet in corresponding space on next flower double_crochet in nxt space chain 1 single_crochet in corresponding space on next flower double_crochet in nxt space ch2 single_crochet in nxt single_crochet* repeat from * to * around join with slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet finish off thread use joins where needed not every time will you have a join see close ups for placement of joins
